<Link id="l00173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="173"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return true if &#39;V &amp; Mask&#39; is known to be zero. We use this predicate to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="174"><Highlight kind="comment">/// simplify operations downstream. Mask is known to be zero for bits that V</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="175"><Highlight kind="comment">/// cannot have.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This function is defined on values with integer type, values with pointer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><Highlight kind="comment">/// type, and vectors of integers.  In the case</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><Highlight kind="comment">/// where V is a vector, the mask, known zero, and known one values are the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><Highlight kind="comment">/// same width as the vector element, and the bit is set only if it is true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for all of the elements in the vector.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a5738f911a81d4a66c8778d86be098dde">MaskedValueIsZero</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/apint">APInt</a> &amp;Mask,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return the number of times the sign bit of the register is replicated into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the other bits. We know that at least 1 bit is always equal to the sign</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">/// bit (itself), but other cases can give us information. For example,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">/// immediately after an &quot;ashr X, 2&quot;, we know that the top 3 bits are all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="comment">/// equal to each other, so we return 3 For vectors, return the number of</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if we can prove that the analyzed floating-point value is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// either NaN or never less than -0.0.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///      NaN --&gt; true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       +0 --&gt; true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00360" /><CodeLine lineNumber="360"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       -0 --&gt; true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   x &gt; +0 --&gt; true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   x &lt; -0 --&gt; false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00363" /><CodeLine lineNumber="363" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownfpclass/#ac068bb13883a326befa8b10d45cb52a2"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownfpclass/#ac068bb13883a326befa8b10d45cb52a2">cannotBeOrderedLessThanZero</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownfpclass/#aa0fbe688ffb115395a2665499c0639a2">isKnownNever</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownfpclass/#a166b63a9217b936dc956f6b65de7602a">OrderedLessThanZeroMask</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if we can prove that the analyzed floating-point value is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// either NaN or never greater than -0.0.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///      NaN --&gt; true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       +0 --&gt; true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///       -0 --&gt; true</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00372" /><CodeLine lineNumber="372"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   x &gt; +0 --&gt; false</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Given an aggregate and an sequence of indices, see if the scalar value</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00627" /><CodeLine lineNumber="627"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00628" /><CodeLine lineNumber="628"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If InsertBefore is not empty, this function will duplicate (modified)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"><Highlight kind="comment">/// insertvalues when a part of a nested struct is extracted.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><Highlight kind="normal">Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae29b7bb67763c63132e57471f88ac80f">FindInsertedValue</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Analyze the specified pointer to see if it can be expressed as a base</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><Highlight kind="comment">/// pointer plus a constant offset. Return the base and offset to the caller.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00737" /><CodeLine lineNumber="737"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00738" /><CodeLine lineNumber="738"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Like getUnderlyingObject(), but will try harder to find a single underlying</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00739" /><CodeLine lineNumber="739"><Highlight kind="comment">/// object. In particular, this function also looks through selects and phis.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00740" /><CodeLine lineNumber="740"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9f25f617547597b1772677eaf0e7a8b6">getUnderlyingObjectAggressive</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;V);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00741" /><CodeLine lineNumber="741"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00742" /><CodeLine lineNumber="742"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method is similar to getUnderlyingObject except that it can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00743" /><CodeLine lineNumber="743"><Highlight kind="comment">/// look through phi and select instructions and return multiple objects.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00744" /><CodeLine lineNumber="744"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00745" /><CodeLine lineNumber="745"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If LoopInfo is passed, loop phis are further analyzed.  If a pointer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00746" /><CodeLine lineNumber="746"><Highlight kind="comment">/// accesses different objects in each iteration, we don&#39;t look through the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00747" /><CodeLine lineNumber="747"><Highlight kind="comment">/// phi node. E.g. consider this loop nest:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00748" /><CodeLine lineNumber="748"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00749" /><CodeLine lineNumber="749"><Highlight kind="comment">///   int &#42;&#42;A;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00750" /><CodeLine lineNumber="750"><Highlight kind="comment">///   for (i)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00751" /><CodeLine lineNumber="751"><Highlight kind="comment">///     for (j) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00752" /><CodeLine lineNumber="752"><Highlight kind="comment">///        A&#91;i&#93;&#91;j&#93; = A&#91;i-1&#93;&#91;j&#93; &#42; B&#91;j&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00753" /><CodeLine lineNumber="753"><Highlight kind="comment">///     &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00754" /><CodeLine lineNumber="754"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00755" /><CodeLine lineNumber="755"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is transformed by Load-PRE to stash away A&#91;i&#93; for the next iteration</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00756" /><CodeLine lineNumber="756"><Highlight kind="comment">/// of the outer loop:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00757" /><CodeLine lineNumber="757"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Curr = A&#91;0&#93;;          // Prev&#95;0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="comment">///   for (i: 1..N) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Prev = Curr;        // Prev = PHI (Prev&#95;0, Curr)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><Highlight kind="comment">///     Curr = A&#91;i&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="comment">///     for (j: 0..N) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><Highlight kind="comment">///        Curr&#91;j&#93; = Prev&#91;j&#93; &#42; B&#91;j&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="comment">///     &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="comment">///   &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Since A&#91;i&#93; and A&#91;i-1&#93; are independent pointers, getUnderlyingObjects</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><Highlight kind="comment">/// should not assume that Curr and Prev share the same underlying object thus</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it shouldn&#39;t look through the phi above.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#acc66c148bcd950ffcc3ab83989eb70bd">getUnderlyingObjects</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;V,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><Highlight kind="normal">                          SmallVectorImpl&lt;const Value &#42;&gt; &amp;Objects,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><Highlight kind="normal">                          </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LoopInfo &#42;LI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxLookup = 6);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is a wrapper around getUnderlyingObjects and adds support for basic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ptrtoint+arithmetic+inttoptr sequences.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><Highlight kind="normal">                                    SmallVectorImpl&lt;Value &#42;&gt; &amp;Objects);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return true if the instruction doesn&#39;t potentially cross vector lanes. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795"><Highlight kind="comment">/// condition is weaker than checking that the instruction is lanewise: lanewise</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00796" /><CodeLine lineNumber="796"><Highlight kind="comment">/// means that the same operation is splatted across all lanes, but we also</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="comment">/// include the case where there is a different operation on each lane, as long</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00798" /><CodeLine lineNumber="798"><Highlight kind="comment">/// as the operation only uses data from that lane. An example of an operation</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00799" /><CodeLine lineNumber="799"><Highlight kind="comment">/// that is not lanewise, but doesn&#39;t cross vector lanes is insertelement.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00800" /><CodeLine lineNumber="800"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a947ca061d5d11bc9ff70f6782261225d">isNotCrossLaneOperation</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00801" /><CodeLine lineNumber="801"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00802" /><CodeLine lineNumber="802"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return true if the instruction does not have any effects besides</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00803" /><CodeLine lineNumber="803"><Highlight kind="comment">/// calculating the result and does not have undefined behavior.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00804" /><CodeLine lineNumber="804"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method never returns true for an instruction that returns true for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00806" /><CodeLine lineNumber="806"><Highlight kind="comment">/// mayHaveSideEffects; however, this method also does some other checks in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00807" /><CodeLine lineNumber="807"><Highlight kind="comment">/// addition. It checks for undefined behavior, like dividing by zero or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00808" /><CodeLine lineNumber="808"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loading from an invalid pointer (but not for undefined results, like a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00809" /><CodeLine lineNumber="809"><Highlight kind="comment">/// shift with a shift amount larger than the width of the result). It checks</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00810" /><CodeLine lineNumber="810"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for malloc and alloca because speculatively executing them might cause a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00811" /><CodeLine lineNumber="811"><Highlight kind="comment">/// memory leak. It also returns false for instructions related to control</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00812" /><CodeLine lineNumber="812"><Highlight kind="comment">/// flow, specifically terminators and PHI nodes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00813" /><CodeLine lineNumber="813"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00814" /><CodeLine lineNumber="814"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If the CtxI is specified this method performs context-sensitive analysis</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00815" /><CodeLine lineNumber="815"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and returns true if it is safe to execute the instruction immediately</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="comment">/// before the CtxI. If the instruction has (transitive) operands that don&#39;t</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"><Highlight kind="comment">/// dominate CtxI, the analysis is performed under the assumption that these</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="comment">/// operands will also be speculated to a point before CxtI.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If the CtxI is NOT specified this method only looks at the instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="comment">/// itself and its operands, so if this method returns true, it is safe to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="comment">/// move the instruction as long as the correct dominance relationships for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the operands and users hold.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This method can return true for instructions that read memory;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="comment">/// for such instructions, moving them may change the resulting value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8601ff0320b6e29a13a2194200853425">isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;CtxI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  AssumptionCache &#42;AC = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DominatorTree &#42;DT = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> TargetLibraryInfo &#42;TLI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><Highlight kind="normal">                                  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UseVariableInfo = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a48ff88949f3f299445076a47f930c198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8601ff0320b6e29a13a2194200853425">isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">inline</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a19ebaad52d11be3121c2bfcbd0f30193"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a19ebaad52d11be3121c2bfcbd0f30193">isSafeToSpeculativelyExecuteWithVariableReplaced</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a8601ff0320b6e29a13a2194200853425">isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This returns the same result as isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute if Opcode is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the actual opcode of Inst. If the provided and actual opcode differ, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><Highlight kind="comment">/// function (virtually) overrides the opcode of Inst with the provided</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Opcode. There are come constraints in this case:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; If Opcode has a fixed number of operands (eg, as binary operators do),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="comment">///   then Inst has to have at least as many leading operands. The function</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><Highlight kind="comment">///   will ignore all trailing operands beyond that number.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; If Opcode allows for an arbitrary number of operands (eg, as CallInsts</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><Highlight kind="comment">///   do), then all operands are considered.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; The virtual instruction has to satisfy all typing rules of the provided</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><Highlight kind="comment">///   Opcode.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; This function is pessimistic in the following sense: If one actually</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><Highlight kind="comment">///   materialized the virtual instruction, then isSafeToSpeculativelyExecute</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><Highlight kind="comment">///   may say that the materialized instruction is speculatable whereas this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><Highlight kind="comment">///   function may have said that the instruction wouldn&#39;t be speculatable.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><Highlight kind="comment">///   This behavior is a shortcoming in the current implementation and not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><Highlight kind="comment">///   intentional.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a5e36553611d3def8cf698c722239718f">isSafeToSpeculativelyExecuteWithOpcode</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Opcode, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;Inst, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;CtxI = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871"><Highlight kind="normal">    AssumptionCache &#42;AC = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DominatorTree &#42;DT = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return true if this function can prove that the instruction I will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><Highlight kind="comment">/// always transfer execution to one of its successors (including the next</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction that follows within a basic block). E.g. this is not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><Highlight kind="comment">/// guaranteed for function calls that could loop infinitely.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In other words, this function returns false for instructions that may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><Highlight kind="comment">/// transfer execution or fail to transfer execution in a way that is not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="961"><Highlight kind="comment">/// captured in the CFG nor in the sequence of instructions within a basic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00962" /><CodeLine lineNumber="962"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00963" /><CodeLine lineNumber="963"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00964" /><CodeLine lineNumber="964"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Undefined behavior is assumed not to happen, so e.g. division is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00965" /><CodeLine lineNumber="965"><Highlight kind="comment">/// guaranteed to transfer execution to the following instruction even</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00966" /><CodeLine lineNumber="966"><Highlight kind="comment">/// though division by zero might cause undefined behavior.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00967" /><CodeLine lineNumber="967"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abff5a423c1f45e23958dde8ee695c9a9">isGuaranteedToTransferExecutionToSuccessor</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Instruction &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00968" /><CodeLine lineNumber="968"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00969" /><CodeLine lineNumber="969"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns true if this block does not contain a potential implicit exit.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00970" /><CodeLine lineNumber="970"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is equivelent to saying that all instructions within the basic block</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00971" /><CodeLine lineNumber="971"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are guaranteed to transfer execution to their successor within the basic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00972" /><CodeLine lineNumber="972"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block. This has the same assumptions w.r.t. undefined behavior as the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00973" /><CodeLine lineNumber="973"><Highlight kind="comment">/// instruction variant of this function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00974" /><CodeLine lineNumber="974"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abff5a423c1f45e23958dde8ee695c9a9">isGuaranteedToTransferExecutionToSuccessor</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BasicBlock &#42;BB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00975" /><CodeLine lineNumber="975"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00976" /><CodeLine lineNumber="976"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return true if every instruction in the range (Begin, End) is</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1150"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Pattern match integer &#91;SU&#93;MIN, &#91;SU&#93;MAX and ABS idioms, returning the kind</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1151"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and providing the out parameter results if we successfully match.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1152"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1153"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For ABS/NABS, LHS will be set to the input to the abs idiom. RHS will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1154"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the negation instruction from the idiom.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1155"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><Highlight kind="comment">/// If CastOp is not nullptr, also match MIN/MAX idioms where the type does</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1157"><Highlight kind="comment">/// not match that of the original select. If this is the case, the cast</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><Highlight kind="comment">/// operation (one of Trunc,SExt,Zext) that must be done to transform the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><Highlight kind="comment">/// type of LHS and RHS into the type of V is returned in CastOp.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1161"><Highlight kind="comment">/// For example:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1162"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %1 = icmp slt i32 %a, i32 4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1163"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %2 = sext i32 %a to i64</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1164"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %3 = select i1 %1, i64 %2, i64 4</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"><Highlight kind="comment">/// -&gt; LHS = %a, RHS = i32 4, &#42;CastOp = Instruction::SExt</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1168"><Highlight kind="normal">SelectPatternResult <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7aad5a0e62a54747f455651ee2dd08ed">matchSelectPattern</a>(Value &#42;V, Value &#42;&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, Value &#42;&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return the canonical comparison predicate for the specified</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1219"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1220"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Attempt to match a simple first order recurrence cycle of the form:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1221"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %iv = phi Ty &#91;%Start, %Entry&#93;, &#91;%Inc, %backedge&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1222"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %inc = binop %iv, %step</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1223"><Highlight kind="comment">/// OR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1224"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %iv = phi Ty &#91;%Start, %Entry&#93;, &#91;%Inc, %backedge&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1225"><Highlight kind="comment">///   %inc = binop %step, %iv</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1226"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1227"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A first order recurrence is a formula with the form: X&#95;n = f(X&#95;(n-1))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1228"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1229"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A couple of notes on subtleties in that definition:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1230"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; The Step does not have to be loop invariant.  In math terms, it can</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1231"><Highlight kind="comment">///   be a free variable.  We allow recurrences with both constant and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1232"><Highlight kind="comment">///   variable coefficients. Callers may wish to filter cases where Step</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1233"><Highlight kind="comment">///   does not dominate P.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1234"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; For non-commutative operators, we will match both forms.  This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1235"><Highlight kind="comment">///   results in some odd recurrence structures.  Callers may wish to filter</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1236"><Highlight kind="comment">///   out recurrences where the phi is not the LHS of the returned operator.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1237"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &#42; Because of the structure matched, the caller can assume as a post</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1238"><Highlight kind="comment">///   condition of the match the presence of a Loop with P&#39;s parent as it&#39;s</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1239"><Highlight kind="comment">///   header &#42;except&#42; in unreachable code.  (Dominance decays in unreachable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1240"><Highlight kind="comment">///   code.)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1241"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1242"><Highlight kind="comment">/// NOTE: This is intentional simple.  If you want the ability to analyze</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1243"><Highlight kind="comment">/// non-trivial loop conditons, see ScalarEvolution instead.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1244"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a5be4877e6cc76e0fe6f8a005c69aa7c2">matchSimpleRecurrence</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> PHINode &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>, BinaryOperator &#42;&amp;BO, Value &#42;&amp;Start,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1245"><Highlight kind="normal">                           Value &#42;&amp;Step);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1247"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Analogous to the above, but starting from the binary operator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1248"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a5be4877e6cc76e0fe6f8a005c69aa7c2">matchSimpleRecurrence</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> BinaryOperator &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, PHINode &#42;&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/option/option-cpp/#a04665169063c8ca1f2ea96c27fc7c2b2">P</a>, Value &#42;&amp;Start,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1249"><Highlight kind="normal">                           Value &#42;&amp;Step);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1250"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1251"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return true if RHS is known to be implied true by LHS.  Return false if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1252"><Highlight kind="comment">/// RHS is known to be implied false by LHS.  Otherwise, return std::nullopt if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1253"><Highlight kind="comment">/// no implication can be made. A &amp; B must be i1 (boolean) values or a vector of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1254"><Highlight kind="comment">/// such values. Note that the truth table for implication is the same as &lt;=u on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1255"><Highlight kind="comment">/// i1 values (but not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1256"><Highlight kind="comment">/// &lt;=s!).  The truth table for both is:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1257"><Highlight kind="comment">///    | T | F (B)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1258"><Highlight kind="comment">///  T | T | F</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1259"><Highlight kind="comment">///  F | T | T</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1260"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (A)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1261"><Highlight kind="normal">std::optional&lt;bool&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af7f2eb961a542779e97c0b3ec7fa6623">isImpliedCondition</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a87b8bfbbe9d8f7146d7f20a5fb42efd0">RHS</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1262"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DataLayout &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1263"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LHSIsTrue = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1264"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">Depth</a> = 0);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1265"><Highlight kind="normal">std::optional&lt;bool&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#af7f2eb961a542779e97c0b3ec7fa6623">isImpliedCondition</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/x86/x86partialreduction-cpp/#a9e1483f7215664a2315c53c3558d9a8d">LHS</a>, CmpPredicate RHSPred,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1266"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;RHSOp0, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Value &#42;RHSOp1,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1267"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> DataLayout &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1268"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> LHSIsTrue = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1269"><Highlight kind="normal">                                       </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a1eb5609345b906d024fbf9e4bc1adc06afe578efb7ca235af77fb0eef7edcf639">Depth</a> = 0);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1270"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1271"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Return the boolean condition value in the context of the given instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
